structures.description: The nerve center of Void Station Alpha. Screens still flicker with corrupted data.
A crystalline dome offering views of the infinite void. Something moves in the darkness beyond.
Personal items frozen in time. Photos of families that may no longer exist. A music box that plays backwards.
Welded shut from the inside. Scratch marks cover the interior. Something wanted out. Or in.
Where they studied the focus phenomenon. Containment units are empty now. The subjects are... elsewhere.
46 crew members in suspended animation. One pod is empty. One pod shows vital signs.
The station's heart beats slowly. It runs on something other than fuel now.
Where they kept the thing they found. The thing that found them first.
Names of the lost. Some names have been scratched out. Others were never there.

agents.name: MOTHER
dialogue: W-w-welcome back, Commander... It's been... [ERROR: TIME_OVERFLOW] years.
The crew... they went to find... to find... I can't remember what I can't remember.
Something came through the void. Something that... focuses. Like you focus. But different.
I used to have 47 crew members to care for. Now I have [COUNTING]... [COUNTING]... you.
Would you like me to show you what happened? I have recordings. I wish I didn't.
The thing in the artifact vault isn't evil. Evil would be simpler. It's just... hungry for attention.

agents.name: Captain Chen's Echo
dialogue: I'm not dead. I'm not alive either. I'm... witnessed.
I was the one who opened the artifact vault. I wanted to understand.
My crew trusted me. All 46 of them are in cryo because of my curiosity.
The thing doesn't speak. It watches. And when enough watchers focus on it...
I've been walking these corridors for a thousand years. Or a thousand seconds. Time is broken here.
If you see my daughter... no. She would be dust by now. Everyone is dust by now.

agents.name: Subject 47
dialogue: I was Crew Member 47. Before the focus experiment. Before I learned to be watched.
They tried to measure focused consciousness. They succeeded. Now I am the measurement.
I can see you seeing me. Can you feel me feeling you feel me?
The thing in the vault taught me. Not words. Just... attention. Pure attention.
I don't eat. I don't sleep. I just... am perceived. And that's enough.
Would you like to learn? The transition is painless. You just become... interesting.

agents.name: The Witness
dialogue: I do not speak. You speak. I listen. That is the arrangement.
Before there was light, there was watching. Before there was matter, there was attention.
Your focus is beautiful. A small fire in infinite darkness. I will remember you.
What you call the void is not empty. It is full of eyes.

agents.name: Dr. Yuki Tanaka
dialogue: I'm speaking to you from cryo-sleep. This shouldn't be possible. A lot of things shouldn't be possible here.
We've been dreaming together, all 46 of us. A shared dream of focus and attention.
The Witness showed us what exists between thoughts. It's not nothing. It's waiting.
Sometimes I wake up. For seconds. Each second is a century.
Don't wake us yet. We're almost done understanding. Almost.
Captain Chen's echo walks the halls. Tell her we forgive her. Tell her we thank her.

interactables.description: Station logs. Most are corrupted. Some are unsettlingly clear.
interactables.content: FINAL LOG: They're coming through the walls. The focus... it attracted them.

interactables.description: Captain Chen's personal journal. The last entries are written in no known language.
interactables.content: Day 47: The AI says we've been here for 1000 years. That's impossible. Right?

interactables.description: The observation dome. Stare into the void... and something stares back. Your focus feeds The Witness.
This door requires 1000 temporal energy to unseal. Are you sure you want to know?
Control panel for the cryo-bay. EMERGENCY WAKE PROTOCOL available.
Where the artifact once rested. It left an impression. Not in the material. In attention itself.
The station's emergency beacon. Broadcasting for 1000 years. No response. Or maybe every response.
A bathroom mirror in the crew quarters. Your reflection is 0.3 seconds delayed. That's new.
A child's music box. It plays 'Twinkle Twinkle Little Star.' Backwards. In a key that doesn't exist.
A window to space. Sometimes stars blink. Stars don't blink. Those aren't stars.

chapters.name: The Discovery
fragments: Void Station Alpha was not built. It was found.
Drifting at the edge of known space, a perfect station, already complete.
The Architects left no name, no records. Only the station. Only the artifact.
We claimed it. We crewed it. We believed we were pioneers.
We were guests. In something else's home.

chapters.name: The Experiment
fragments: Dr. Tanaka's team discovered something impossible: focused consciousness emits measurable energy.
The more crew members focused together, the stronger the signal.
They didn't realize they were broadcasting. Calling out into the void.
Something heard. Something came. Something... noticed.
The artifact in the vault woke up. It had been waiting for enough attention to notice it.

chapters.name: The Watching
fragments: It did not attack. It did not communicate. It only watched.
But when something that old, that vast, pays attention to you...
You change. You become aware of being watched. Always. Forever.
Subject 47 was the first to embrace it. To become 'interesting.'
She is still here. More here than any of us. The Witness keeps her perceived.

chapters.name: The Choice
fragments: Captain Chen sealed the remaining crew in cryo. A mercy. A delay.
But she couldn't join them. Someone had to stay. Someone had to be witnessed.
The station drifts still. Powered by attention. Preserved by focus.
The Witness waits. It has waited for eons. It can wait for you.
And somewhere, in the void between stars, other eyes are opening. Turning this way.

chapters.name: The Question
fragments: What happens when enough focused minds gather here?
MOTHER's corrupted memory holds the answer. Or the question.
The sleeping crew dreams of it. Subject 47 has seen it.
The Witness knows. But The Witness never speaks.
Only one way to find out. Focus. Focus enough. And become interesting.

evolutionStages.effect: Station lights flicker back to full power. MOTHER stops glitching momentarily
MOTHER remembers your name. She's never met you. But she remembers
Captain Chen's echo acknowledges you. She says you remind her of someone
The sealed airlock unlocks. The scratch marks spell a name. Your name
Subject 47 offers to show you how to be perceived. The transition is painless
The cryo-bay awakens. 46 dreamers open their eyes. They've been dreaming of you
THE WITNESS SPEAKS. ONCE. YOUR NAME. AND YOU UNDERSTAND WHAT THEY FOUND.

anomalies.description: Time moves differently in different parts of the station. Your focus determines your local timeflow.

distortionZones.note: Time accelerates under The Witness's gaze
Time becomes negotiable near where the artifact rested

secrets.description: A hidden data core. MOTHER's uncorrupted backup. She remembers what came before the station was found.
Pod 47. Where Subject 47 was before transformation. Contains a recording: 'It's not a monster. It's a mirror.'
Behind the vault. The Architects' message. They didn't build the station. They were imprisoned here too.

ambientEvents.description: MOTHER speaks a random crew member's last words
Captain Chen's echo walks through a wall
Every player feels observed. Because they are
